HomePage.title: Kawada GoKart RFID
HomePage.subtitle: Lap Counter System
HomePage.description: High-precision lap counter based on <primary>CF-815 4-Port UHF RFID Reader</primary> (860-960MHz, 8-10m range). Bringing automated <secondary>10s Anti-Shake</secondary>, <secondary>Real-time Viz</secondary>, and <secondary>Audio Feedback</secondary> to karting events.
HomePage.featuresSubtitle: Smart RFID system designed for high-speed karting events

cta.title: Ready to Start?
cta.description: Download and deploy GoKart RFID system now to bring professional lap timing to your races

autoLap.title: Auto Lap Counter
autoLap.description: High-precision identification based on UHF RFID, with 10s anti-duplicate protection ensuring 100% accuracy.

visualDashboard.title: Visual Dashboard
visualDashboard.description: 1080P full-screen optimized interface with color-coded status (Running/Final Lap/Finished/Inactive).

audioFeedback.title: Audio Feedback
audioFeedback.description: Distinct tones for each lap and victory sound sequence upon completion to enhance race experience.

realtimeLog.title: Real-time Log
realtimeLog.description: Color-coded event log system distinguishing raw data, lap records, and errors.

sessionControl.title: Session Control
sessionControl.description: Supports manual start/reset for individual karts to handle various race scenarios.

sqliteStorage.title: SQLite Storage
sqliteStorage.description: Local database storage for lap times, supporting historical queries and statistical analysis.

metadata.title: About Us | GoKart RFID
metadata.description: Learn about the development background, technical architecture, and team of the GoKart RFID Lap Counter system.

hero.title: Professional RFID Solutions Provider
hero.description: We specialize in commercial applications and custom development of RFID technology, offering one-stop solutions from consulting and development to deployment and maintenance for clients across various industries.

content.p1: In karting events, traditional manual timing is prone to errors and inefficient. To solve this, we developed this automated timing system based on the <primary>CF-815 UHF RFID Reader</primary>.
content.p2: The system automatically identifies karts crossing the finish line via RFID technology, coupled with a carefully designed <secondary>10-second anti-shake algorithm</secondary>, ensuring accurate counting for every lap even at high speeds.
content.p3: After multiple iterations and field testing, the system creates stable support for 20 concurrent karts, providing real-time visualization, audio feedback, and complete data recording.

items.title: Project Refactoring
items.description: Comprehensive refactoring of the original code, establishing a clear architecture and configuration system.

items.title: SDK Upgrade
items.description: Upgraded CF-815 SDK to the latest version, optimizing communication protocols for improved stability and response speed.

items.title: Feature Completion
items.description: Added audio feedback, SQLite storage, and session management functions.

items.title: Anti-Shake Optimization
items.description: Implemented 10-second anti-duplicate algorithm to solve misread issues in high-speed scenarios.

items.title: Project Kickoff
items.description: Developed the first kart lap counting prototype based on the CF-815 reader.

kawada.name: Ken Chan
kawada.description: Responsible for overall architecture design, hardware integration, and core algorithm development.

antigravity.name: Kawada Technology
antigravity.description: Assisting in project refactoring, documentation, and best practice guidance.

openSource.title: 100% Open Source
openSource.description: We believe in the power of open source. All code for GoKart RFID is public on GitHub. Contributions, suggestions, and issue reports are welcome.
